intro: Epilobium brevistylum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved willowherb, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers arranged in dense spikes, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, riverbanks, and wetlands. Epilobium brevistylum is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms.
